qas.question: What are some examples of soviet memorabilia that can be purchased at Vernissage?
What types of crafts can be purchased at Vernissage?

answers.text: woodcarving, antiques, fine lace, and the hand-knotted wool carpets and kilims

context: Yerevan Vernissage (<a3_0>arts and crafts market<a3_0/>), close to Republic Square, bustles with hundreds of vendors selling a variety of crafts on weekends and Wednesdays (though the selection is much reduced mid-week). The market offers <a2_0>woodcarving, antiques, fine lace, and the hand-knotted wool carpets and kilims<a2_0/> that are a Caucasus specialty. Obsidian, which is found locally, is crafted into assortment of <a0_0>jewellery and ornamental objects<a0_0/>. Armenian gold smithery enjoys a long tradition, populating one corner of the market with a selection of gold items. Soviet relics and souvenirs of recent Russian manufacture – <a1_0>nesting dolls, watches, enamel boxes<a1_0/> and so on – are also available at the Vernisage.
